content.problem: Convert the quadratic function f(x) = 2x² - 3x + 1 to vertex form by completing the square.
steps:
Step 1: Factor out the leading coefficient from the first two terms
f(x) = 2(x² - 3x/2) + 1

Step 2: Complete the square inside the parentheses
For x² - 3x/2, take half of -3/2, which is -3/4, and square it: (-3/4)² = 9/16
f(x) = 2(x² - 3x/2 + 9/16 - 9/16) + 1
f(x) = 2((x - 3/4)² - 9/16) + 1

Step 3: Distribute the leading coefficient
f(x) = 2(x - 3/4)² - 2(9/16) + 1
f(x) = 2(x - 3/4)² - 18/16 + 1

Step 4: Simplify the constant terms
f(x) = 2(x - 3/4)² - 18/16 + 16/16
f(x) = 2(x - 3/4)² - 2/16
f(x) = 2(x - 3/4)² - 1/8
content.explanation: Completing the square with fractions requires careful attention to detail, especially when finding half of the coefficient of x and when squaring that value. The process is the same as with integers, but the arithmetic can be more challenging.
